conversation.text: Hi are you ready? If you are, start off by preheating the oven and cleaning the jalapenos
evidence: Preheat the oven and clean the jalapeños

conversation.text: What degrees should I set?
Heat the oven at 218 degrees celsius and use a rimmed baking sheet. Once you have rinced the jalapenos, dry them and place them on baking sheet
evidence: Turn the oven on to 425 °F (218 °C) and get out a rimmed baking sheet

conversation.text: Do I need to cut them into slices?
No, the jalapenos should be left whole. Spread each whole jalapeno by 1 inch apart and drizzle them with either olive, vegetable or avocado oil
evidence: Spread the whole jalapeños on the baking sheet.

conversation.text: Wait, I haven't cleaned the jalapenos yet. Do I wash it directly?
Yes, as mentioned in a previous message, you should rinse the jalapenos before placing them on the baking sheet.
evidence: Rinse as many jalapeños as you want to roast and dry them on a kitchen towel

conversation.text: Do I need to scrape out the seeds?
As mentioned previously, the jalapenos do not need to be cut. They are roasted whole which means no need to scrape out the seeds or the interior. Are we ready to move after the oiling step?
evidence: Spread the whole jalapeños on the baking sheet.

conversation.text: Okay fine. I'm ready.
Once you have oiled the jalapenos, roast them for 7-8 minutes until they begin to soften and turn a little dark on the bottom.
evidence: Roast the jalapeños for 7 to 8 minutes

conversation.text: Got it. Do I need to turn them during the 7-minute span or after?
Once the first 7 minute span is over, you should turn and roast the jalapenos for a further 7 - 8 minutes. They will be done when they are soft, wrinkly and dark
evidence: Turn and roast the jalapeños for 7 to 8 more minutes.

conversation.text: Got it. What's next?
Once they are done, remove the jalapenos from the oven and finish he peppers by steaming them and peeling off their skin
How do I steam them?
It is not specified however you can steam them by either using a steamer or placing them in a covered bowl for a few minutes
evidence: Finish the peppers by steaming and peeling them.

conversation.text: Why steaming? They are soft are should be ready to serve now...
It is not specified in the recipe, however, I am assuming the steaming is to make it easier to peel them. That is the end of the rcip
evidence: Finish the peppers by steaming and peeling them.

conversation.text: Okay then I'll skip it and peel the pepper directly.
Thats great. The recipe is now over. Thank you for following it

recipe.title: How to Roast Jalapenos in the Oven

procedure.summary: Preheat the oven and clean the jalapeños.
procedure.description: Turn the oven on to 425 °F (218 °C) and get out a rimmed baking sheet. Rinse as many jalapeños as you want to roast and dry them on a kitchen towel.

procedure.summary: Oil the jalapeños on the baking sheet.
procedure.description: Spread the whole jalapeños on the baking sheet. Leave a little space (at least 1 inch or 2.5 cm) between each pepper. Drizzle the jalapeños with 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of oil. You can use olive, vegetable, or avocado oil.

procedure.summary: Roast the jalapeños for 7 to 8 minutes.
procedure.description: Put the sheet in the preheated oven and roast the peppers until they begin to soften and turn a little dark on the bottom. This should take 7 to 8 minutes.

procedure.summary: Turn and roast the jalapeños for 7 to 8 more minutes.
procedure.description: Wear oven mitts and remove the baking sheet from the oven. Use tongs to turn each jalapeño over. Put the pan back in the oven and roast them for 7 to 8 more minutes. The jalapeños should become very soft, wrinkly, and dark.
Wear oven mitts to take the sheet pan out of the oven. Finish the peppers by steaming and peeling them.
